Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Peripheral Nerve Injury After Varicose Vein Surgery Using Endovenous Laser Ablation

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable as this was not a randomised trial.

Participants.evidence: A total of 25 patients were enrolled from 2021 to 2023, undergoing EVLA of the great saphenous vein (GSV) with or without microphlebectomy.

Intervention.evidence: undergoing EVLA of the great saphenous vein (GSV) with or without microphlebectomy.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate peripheral nerve injury (PNI) after varicose vein (VV) surgery using endovenous laser ablation (EVLA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was PNI, defined as >40% elevation in current perception threshold (CPT) from preoperative data, measured at 6 points on each leg preoperatively and at 1 week, 1 month, and 6 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable as this was not a randomised trial.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 25 patients were enrolled from 2021 to 2023

Result_Outcome.evidence: Significant CPT elevation was observed at the knee joint level (P = 0.01) and upper portion of the lower leg (P = 0.008) 1 week postoperatively.
